intro: Stevensia farinosa, commonly known as the dustymallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Stevensia farinosa is a perennial herb that is adapted to drought conditions and is sometimes used in xeriscaping.
